entry.def: If you say that someone trousers a sum of money, you mean that they receive it, usually when they do not deserve it or should not take it.

example.ex: Many people think that ex-ministers are trousering £25,000 in fees simply for going to a few board meetings a year.
example.tran: 很多人认为前任部长们一年仅参加几次理事会就轻而易举地捞取了 25,000 英镑的报酬。

means.word_mean: 1. garment designed for or relating to trousers;
